column1: Table 1. Features Included in Final Model (sorted by Descending Feature Importance in Best Model [Gradient Boosting Regressor])

column4: Feature_Description
Individual Solver 2 (IS2) raw solve time per puzzle, in minutes
aka Recent Performance Baseline(RPB). Non-time-decay  weighted (ndw), Strength of Schedule (SOS)-adjusted, mean of previous (to a given IS2_ST) 10 puzzles, for the relevant 15x15 puzzle day
Standard deviation of the solve times used to generate 'Recent Performance Baseline' ('RPB') for a given puzzle to be predicted on (aka IS_pds_l10_ndw_SOS_adj (recent solve variability)
Assigns number to a given solve for the 15x 15 puzzle day of week (Mon-Sat)
Assigns percentile across all puzzles from all puzzle days for 'Freshness Factor'
Assigns an overall rarity score to a puzzle’s answers, using both pre-Shortz and Shortz puzzles
Number of solves across all 15x15 puzzle days prior to a solve to be predicted; experience proxy

Past performance vs a specific constructor or specific constructor team; normalized to account for recent (past 10 puzzles) performance baseline per puzzle day (RPB) and past puzzle day mix for constructor(s)
Number of solves on a given 15x15 puzzle day prior to a solve to be predicted; experience proxy
Average number of squares per answer. XWord Info calls answers “words”.
Counts all answers that would not be playable based on the Official Scrabble Dictionary
Counts all white squares that are non-adjacent to black squares
Total # of answers in the puzzles. XWord Info calls answers “words”
Counts all answers not occurring in any other pre-Shortz or Shortz Era puzzle
Mean, normalized (to control for puzzle day) past solve time difference from RPB for the 6-hour solve phase during which a given puzzle being predicted on was solved
Assigns percentile across all puzzles for the puzzle day of a given puzzle for 'Freshness Factor'
Treats each white square like a (non-blank) Scrabble tile and assigns total point value for the puzzle
Number of solves in the last 7 calendar days prior to a given solve
Blocks = black squares
Hour (Eastern Time) that a solve was completed
Scrabble Score/Number of white squares
Subjective count of clues displaying wordplay/punnery; many end with a ‘?’, ‘perhaps’, or ‘maybe’
Number of fill-in-the-blank answers in a given puzzle. Mostly seen in early-week puzzles.
Counts the number (out of 26) of letters not used in a puzzle (0= pangram)
Clue that refers to another clue (ex. “See 48-Down”)
Counts number of squares where more than one letter, number or symbol is required for a solve
Blocks than can be removed without affecting the overall word count of the grid
When the same clue is used verbatim for more than one answer (uncommon)
Same as 'Rebus #', but only counts squares with unique rebus content in the given puzzle
Counts # of times two or more adjacent rows or columns have all white squares (mostly Fri or Sat)
Portion of 24 hour cycle a puzzle was solved in (1 = 12-6 AM; 2 = 6 AM-12 PM; 3 = 12 PM-6 PM; 4 = 6 PM-12 AM)
Assigns ‘1’ to all puzzles displaying other than normal rotational symmetry (e.g., L-R Mirror or Diagonal)
# of squares with circles in them. Used to reveal themes. Mostly seen in early week and Sunday puzzles
Counts all shaded squares in the grid. Mostly seen in early week and Sunday puzzles.
Number of black squares in the grid that contain at least one character (very rare)
When the same answer is used verbatim for more than one clue (rare)
Number of “virtual” squares outside the grid that contain at least one character (very rare)
1 denotes more than 1 valid answer for a clue (very rare)
Counts # of row or columns with 0 black squares (15 or 21 answer length, depending on grid size)
Squares that are part of only either the Across or Down clue, but not both
When the same clue is used for both an Across and a Down entry (very rare)

column1: Table 2. Parameters/Hyperparameters and Outcome Measurements  (Training Set Cross-Validation) for Gradient Boosting Regressor Model [Best Model by RMSE]

n_estimators

column4: Parameter
max_iterations

column1: Table 4. Parameters/Hyperparameters and Outcome Measurements  (Training Set Cross-Validation) for Random Forest Regressor Model
NOTE: Unless specified below, parameter value is sklearn default (https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.ensemble.RandomForestRegressor.html)

column4: Parameter
n_estimators

column1: Table 5. Parameters/Hyperparameters and Outcome Measurements  (Training Set Cross-Validation) for Linear Regression Model
NOTE: Unless specified below, parameter value is sklearn default (https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.LinearRegression.html)

column4: Parameter
selectbest_k
